issue.title: bug: Geolocation on Android always returning 'location unavailable'
issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version
<!--
Paste the output from the `npx cap doctor` command into the code block below. This will provide the versions of Capacitor packages and related dependencies.
-->

```
💊   Capacitor Doctor  💊 

Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/core: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/android: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/ios: 3.2.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/core: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/android: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/ios: 3.1.2

[error] Xcode is not installed
[success] Android looking great! 👌
```

### Platform(s)
<!--
List the platforms that this bug affects.
-->
Android 10


### Current Behavior
<!--
Describe how the bug manifests. Be specific.
-->
When I try to call Geolocation.getCurrentPosition(), I always get an error: 'location unavailable'. I've tried this with no options and {enableHighAccuracy: true}.

I have the appropriate permissions set and the code works on PWA and iOS. The app has Location permission while in the foreground and Google Maps can get my location fine.


### Expected Behavior
<!--
Describe what the behavior should be.
-->

Geolocation.getCurrentPosition() should provide the lat/lng of the current position.

### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->

**edit:** basic repo set up here: https://github.com/jonathan-chin/capacitor-geocode-android-example
clicking on the `get currentposition` button will return `location unavailable` when running on a Google Pixel 3A on Android 10 through Android Studio.

it seems to have been an existing issue in the past #2854 but I am still experiencing it.

issue.title: bug: React IonRange gets into infinite render loop

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: @ionic/react package

issue.body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, please consult our docs (https://ionicframework.com/docs/). -->

<!-- Please make sure you are posting an issue pertaining to the Ionic Framework. If you are having an issue with the Ionic Appflow services (Ionic View, Ionic Deploy, etc.) please consult the Ionic Appflow support portal (https://ionic.zendesk.com/hc/en-us) -->

<!-- Please do not submit support requests or "How to" questions here. Instead, please use one of these channels: https://forum.ionicframework.com/ or http://ionicworldwide.herokuapp.com/ -->

<!-- ISSUES MISSING IMPORTANT INFORMATION MAY BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATION. -->

# Bug Report

**Ionic version:**
<!-- (For Ionic 1.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v1) -->
<!-- (For Ionic 2.x & 3.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v3) -->
[x] **5.0.7**

**Current behavior:**
I'm using the `IonRange` component with `dualKnobs`. When trying to set a default value _and_ update state with `onIonChange` the parent component gets into an infinite render loop as soon as I update the range state. 

**Expected behavior:**
I should be able set the default value of the `lower` and `upper` knobs by setting the `value` prop of `IonRange`. This works, but as soon slide one of the knobs, the parent component repeatedly re-renders forever.  


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a component with that renders an `IonRange` component and also `useState`. You can see an example here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ionic-react-demo-tt4ytk?file=pages%2FHome.jsx

As soon as you adjust one of the knobs (and `onIonChange` is called), you will see that the component is rendered in a loop - `console.log('render')` is called repeatedly forever.

**Related code:**
```
const MyComponent = () => {
  const defaultValue = {lower: 40, upper: 70};
  const [range, setRange] = useState(defaultValue);
  
  console.log('render');

  return (
    <IonRange dualKnobs={true} min={0} max={100} value={{...defaultValue}} onIonChange={ e => setRange(e.detail.value) }>
      <IonLabel slot="start">{range.lower}</IonLabel>
      <IonLabel slot="end">{range.upper}</IonLabel>
    </IonRange>        
  );
};
```


**Other information:**
<!-- List any other information that is relevant to your issue. Stack traces, related issues, suggestions on how to fix, Stack Overflow links, forum links, etc. -->

**Ionic info:**
<!-- (run `ionic info` from a terminal/cmd prompt and paste output below): -->

```
Ionic:

   Ionic CLI       : 6.6.0 
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/react 5.0.7

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI   : 2.0.0
   @capacitor/core : 2.0.0

Utility:

   cordova-res : not installed
   native-run  : not installed

System:

   NodeJS : v12.16.1 
   npm    : 6.13.4
   OS     : macOS Catalina
```

issue.title: feat: `ionChange` event: determine whether it by user interaction

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: a new feature, enhancement, or improvement

labels.name: package: core
labels.description: @ionic/core package

issue.body:
# Feature Request

**Ionic version:**
<!-- (For Ionic 1.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v1) -->
<!-- (For Ionic 2.x & 3.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v3) -->
[x] **4.10**

**Describe the Feature Request**
Add a way to figure out if the `checked` value of `ion-toggle` was changed by user interaction or programatically.

**Describe Preferred Solution**
Add a new property to the event object or the `detail` property.

**Describe Alternatives**

1. Add a new event (e.g. `ionUserChange`) that only fires on user interaction. 
2. Add the original event to `detail`.

All of these solutions could be expanded to other components.

**Related Code**
Same request: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic/issues/17123

**Additional Context**
My use case: I have a dark mode toggle and on `ionChange` I save the user's preference. Until the user manually sets the toggle I use the OS setting (which I get using `window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')`). When the OS setting changes the toggle should change as well. But this saves the new value and no longer checks the OS preference.

Presenting an inline overlay (popover or modal) a second time will result in the content of the overlay not displaying. 

Caused by: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/pull/26154

### Expected Behavior

Inline overlays should consistently display their contents, regardless if the first time the overlay is presented or the 100th. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an inline overlay with popover or modal
2. Open the overlay
3. Observe: Overlay displays correctly
4. Close the overlay
5. Re-open the overlay
6. Observe: The overlay is blank
7. Inspecting the DOM will show that `.ion-delegate-host` element is created and pushes the overlay contents off screen.

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

N/A

### Additional Information

_No response_

labels.name: Awaiting Reply

labels.name: ionitron: needs reproduction
labels.description: This PR or Issue does not have a reproduction case URL

issue.body:
# Bug
Unable to run a single e2e test

## Details
Unable to run single e2e test after upgrading from _v2.16.1_ to _v2.19.3_

Command used: `npx stencil test --e2e dialog.e2e.ts`

## Work around
I am able to get the same functionality by adding `--` as an extra arg

Command used: `npx stencil test --e2e -- dialog.e2e.ts`

## Screenshots

### v2.16.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779216-03966fd1-452c-4e9d-9642-81c38048b817.png)

### v2.19.3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779088-7b4d28dd-217f-4f62-a74c-a85a3b98ba53.png)

### v2.19.3 with workaround
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779425-2dc0b7ec-852d-422a-a915-925aa249cfbd.png)

_Originally posted by @bamsargeant in https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/3827#issuecomment-1338509558_

issue.title: bug: plugin for IOS custom viewController will not display view.
issue.body:
## Bug Report
I'm building a plugin and my custom view will not open. It acts like the view controller can't find the xib file.
see [stackoverflow](url) 
### Capacitor Version

```
💊   Capacitor Doctor  💊 

Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.4.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.3.0

[success] iOS looking great! 👌
```

### Platform(s)
IOS, I have the plugin working fine on Android

### Current Behavior
My issue is that the view doesn't display, I get a black screen on the simulator. It's like the controller can't find the xib view file. Degbugging I get the events firing: viewDidLoad(), ViewDidAppear(). The links between the controller and the xib are all good in xCode. I tested with an UIAlertController and it displays OK.

### Expected Behavior
Load my map view

### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->
```
DispatchQueue.main.async {
    let  mapCtrl = NavigateRouteViewController(withRouteInfo: routeInfo)
    mapCtrl.modalPresentationStyle = .fullScreen
    self.bridge!.viewController!.present(mapCtrl, animated: true, completion: nil)            
}
```


### Other Technical Details

`npm --version` output: 8.19.2

`node --version` output: v16.13.0

`pod --version` output (iOS issues only): 1.10.1

### Additional Context

issue.title: bug: useIonLoading, message container is always rendered even when not using a message

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: @ionic/react package

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

Using the useIonLoading() hook with the minimum parameters, we have a design error.

![useIonLoading bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199714749-bec1da11-0309-4af3-afab-4c83915d4b24.png)
![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199715939-f0df1373-5576-47f5-a50a-d5b39d76b1c2.png)

This element should not render if the message parameter is empty.

![bug-example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199715438-0f683756-34a8-4632-9410-09d0e385da73.png)

### Expected Behavior

This should be the default behavior.
![default_behaviour](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199716071-10f44788-41f6-4e4a-8322-afa8d0b80dfc.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

Using the `<IonLoading isOpen={true} />` component works perfectly. The bug is not in the core. The bug occurs when receiving the default parameters in useIonLoading.

````tsx
const [present, dismiss] = useIonLoading();
useEffect(()=>{
    present();
}, [])
````

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI       : 6.20.3
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/react 6.3.4

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI      : not installed
   @capacitor/android : not installed
   @capacitor/core    : not installed
   @capacitor/ios     : not installed

Utility:

   cordova-res : 0.15.4
   native-run  : not installed globally

System:

   NodeJS : v14.16.0
   npm    : 6.14.11
   OS     : macOS Monterey

### Additional Information

This happens with @ionic/react in version 6.3.4 using the useIonLoading() hook.

issue.title: bug: cloned title element doesn't reflect color and font-size
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

When using a `--color` or `font-size` on an `<ion-title>` on an collapsable header, the cloned title element that is used for the animation doesn't reflect this styles, what results in a buggy animation:

![ezgif com-gif-maker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20899975/199695843-375f9556-3225-42ab-a191-1122673ea075.gif)

The cloned element always is black and jumps after the animation is finished into the original state. Also i mentioned that the BackButton Text is not correctly aligned to the cloned element (it should be over each other to have the effect of turning into the title)

### Expected Behavior

- The cloned element should respect the original title's styling
- The animation should match with the back button text

### Steps to Reproduce

See attached repo and the gif above

### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/EinfachHans/ionic-title-animation-bug

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI                     : 6.20.3 (/Users/hans/.nvm/versions/node/v16.17.0/lib/node_modules/@ionic/cli)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 6.3.4

issue.title: bug: Popovers won't open after routerlink in multiple instances of same component
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

I have created a datetime picker component with an input with popover and a datetime picker inside. I am using it in multiple pages. I start with either page 1 or page 2. On the page where I clicked the input (with popover) to open the datepicker FIRST it will open the popover. 
Then I go to the other page by clicking on a button with a routerLink, and the popover doesn't show when I click on the (same) input. 

If I manually goto the pages (without a routerlink) by changing the URL in the address bar the popover works correctly. 

I have also added code with a modal and this works correctly on both pages. 

It seems 2 other people had a similar issue but it was never addressed



### Expected Behavior

Pop over opens on both pages after navigating with routerLink. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the application. 
2. goto page 1
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85735582/199516525-1f7f5514-4162-4d84-9aac-7993547145d1.png)

4. Click on the date input for start date
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85735582/199516617-7092249c-2d6a-4025-bcd6-e5302de68172.png)
Pop over Shows

5. Select a date and see it in the input
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85735582/199518536-465b243a-d13d-4358-b46d-19dd330459d3.png)

6. Click the button to goto Page 2
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85735582/199516991-6cf180fb-3186-4d6d-bbfa-1546428dbe0e.png)

7. Click the input for start date (again)
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85735582/199517114-341afac4-ba64-4db8-9da3-031072e11b4d.png)

No matter what I click the popover will not show anymore. 
Going back to page 1 will still have a working popover, but on page 2 it doesn't work. 

If you start by going to page 2 first and then to page 1, the popover will work on page 2, but not on page 1. 






### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/DDQ-NL/datetimepopoverissue

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI                     : 6.19.1 (C:\Users\joepv\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\@ionic\cli)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 6.3.3
   @angular-devkit/build-angular : 14.2.7
   @angular-devkit/schematics    : 14.2.7
   @angular/cli                  : 14.2.7
   @ionic/angular-toolkit        : 6.1.0

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI      : 4.4.0
   @capacitor/android : not installed
   @capacitor/core    : 4.4.0
   @capacitor/ios     : not installed

Utility:

   cordova-res : not installed globally
   native-run  : 1.7.1

System:

   NodeJS : v16.13.1 (C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe)
   npm    : 8.3.0
   OS     : Windows 10

### Additional Information

Related issues (from my google search)

https://forum.ionicframework.com/t/ionic-inline-popover-and-routerlink-angular/222271
https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues/25946

BTW a little history: I resorted to this popover 'solution' because the datetime picker had so many issues and big changes going to Ionic version 6...
Initial code copied from here: https://www.damirscorner.com/blog/posts/20220107-DatePickerPopupInIonic6.html

issue.body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, please consult our docs (https://ionicframework.com/docs/). -->

<!-- Please make sure you are posting an issue pertaining to the Ionic Framework. If you are having an issue with the Ionic Appflow services (Ionic View, Ionic Deploy, etc.) please consult the Ionic Appflow support portal (https://ionic.zendesk.com/hc/en-us) -->

<!-- Please do not submit support requests or "How to" questions here. Instead, please use one of these channels: https://forum.ionicframework.com/ or http://ionicworldwide.herokuapp.com/ -->

<!-- ISSUES MISSING IMPORTANT INFORMATION MAY BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATION. -->

# Feature Request

**Ionic version:**
<!-- (For Ionic 1.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v1) -->
<!-- (For Ionic 2.x & 3.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v3) -->
```
@ionic/angular 5.6.0
```

**Describe the Feature Request**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the feature request is. Please include if your feature request is related to a problem. -->
When double tapping upon the button with Talkback or Voiceover, the dialogue should be designed as such that it can be viewable in text form and read out loud by Talkback and voiceover. The modals should also remain in focus until pressing the ‘cancel’ button or the ‘okay’ button to confirm the action. It should announce the label when opening so that user can identify that what popup is opened on screen. This should be on every overlay component like
- Alerts
- Action sheet
- Modal
- Date-time picker

**Related Code**
<!-- If you are able to illustrate the feature request with an example, please provide a sample application via an online code collaborator such as [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com), or [GitHub](https://github.com). -->
[Downlead code here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TfR-9kxiYYeVQkr6WOEjHaSuN_ZIq9my/view?usp=sharing)

issue.title: No smooth and overlapping when navcontroller.pop()

labels.name: needs: reply
labels.description: the issue needs a response from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

I've created a sample application to demonstrate the problem that only happen in Android. I have test with cordova and capacitor but this sample is with capacitor and with two differents terminales, Xiaomi Mi A1 and Motorola g30

I have two pages, one with a list an other for detail.

You have a list of <ion-item> (93  items) that you can click and go to detail page.  Items is a variable with an array with objects set manually (no loading from database or api).

```html
<ion-item (click)="edit()" *ngFor="let o of data; let i=index; trackBy: trackBy">
     {{o._id}} - {{o.name}}
</ion-item>
```

Once in the detail, whose --background is red to see better what I mean, I have two buttons, one that returns to the list page using router.navigate and another using navController.pop().
```html
<ion-button (click)="salir()">salir router</ion-button>
<ion-button (click)="salirPop()">salir pop</ion-button>
```
```javascript
salir(){
    this.router.navigate(['/']);
 }
salirPop(){
    this.navCtrl.pop()
}
```

Both, when animating is running to back from detail to list, the detail page is overlapping for a few moments over list and transition animation is not smooth.  You can see is most noticiable with pop. If a left only one item in list then works smooth and without overlapping.

I have recorded the screen to better understand what I mean. In the video I click in one item, after in detail I click first in pop button, second time in router button..  (I explain because in video yo can't see where I'm touching).

Xiaomi

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1634767/202385209-f4522173-13bb-496c-8c65-42588fa893cf.mp4

Motorola

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1634767/202386845-2bf435ca-9eab-40df-aeae-d19cf6d49dcc.mp4

This is only an example to show you the problem. I detect it in a project I'm migrating from ionic3 to ionic6. I'm finishing migration and I check my new project in iOS and web and works fine but not in android.

### Expected Behavior

Should work smooth and without overlapping in Android like is doing in web and iOS.

### Steps to Reproduce

I have prepare a repo to you where you can reproduce this issue.


### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/goltra/ionic6-test-pop-route

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI                     : 6.20.3 (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@ionic/cli)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 6.3.6
   @angular-devkit/build-angular : 14.2.9
   @angular-devkit/schematics    : 14.2.9
   @angular/cli                  : 14.2.9
   @ionic/angular-toolkit        : 6.1.0

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI      : 4.4.0
   @capacitor/android : 4.4.0
   @capacitor/core    : 4.4.0
   @capacitor/ios     : not installed

Utility:

   cordova-res : 0.15.4
   native-run  : 1.7.1

System:

   NodeJS : v14.17.0 (/usr/local/bin/node)
   npm    : 6.14.13
   OS     : macOS Catalina

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: bug: CORS error when changing server.hostname on iOS
issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version
<!--
Paste the output from the `npx cap doctor` command into the code block below. This will provide the versions of Capacitor packages and related dependencies.
-->

```
💊   Capacitor Doctor  💊 

Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.4.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.3.0

[success] iOS looking great! 👌
[error] com is missing in
        /Users/'user'/Projects/'project'/'project/'project'/packages/'package'/android/app/src/main/java.
        Please create a directory structure matching the Package ID 'appId' within the
        /Users/'user'/Projects/'project'/'project'/'project'/packages/'package'/android/app/src/main/java
        directory.
```

### Platform(s)

1. iOS



### Current Behavior
<!--
As it stands now the app works fine in iOS with the default server.hostname config in `capacitor.config.ts` but when I change the hostname to anything else like `sub.example.co.uk` the android app works fine but the iOS app throws a CORS error in Safari when I make a PUT request.
-->
As it stands now the app works fine in iOS with the default server.hostname config in `capacitor.config.ts` but when I change the hostname to anything else like `sub.example.co.uk` the android app works fine but the iOS app throws a CORS error in Safari when I make a PUT request.



### Expected Behavior
<!--
Describe what the behavior should be.
-->
The app should make that PUT request in Safari without a CORS error



### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->
I'll have to spin up a whole CORS enabled back-end for that




### Other Technical Details
<!--
Please provide the following information with your request and any other relevant technical details (versions of IDEs, local environment info, plugin information or links, etc).
-->

`npm --version` output: 8.11.0

`node --version` output: v16.15.1

`pod --version` output (iOS issues only): 1.11.3

CapacitorCookies plugin is enabled on iOS, but it does not really matter because i get the same behaviour if i disable it.

### Additional Context
<!--
List any other information that is relevant to your issue. Stack traces, related issues, suggestions on how to fix, Stack Overflow links, forum links, etc.
-->
Of course CORS is enabled on the back-end and the origins are added on the server.
For android is `http://server.hostname` 
And for iOS is `capacitor://server.hostname`
*Replace `server.hostname` with whatever you have in `capacitor.config.ts` at server.hostname*

I'll attach some screenshots with the failed request.
I am unable to see the preflight for the request because Safari doesn't have that feature

### iOS:
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 10 21 52 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94641613/199437422-2e1dbd0e-4cce-44bd-b4f3-805dd161be32.png)
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 10 23 21 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94641613/199437436-5452df73-fe17-4ff3-a6cb-934fc65023c7.png)

### Android:
Preflight request:
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 10 31 55 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94641613/199439615-79a4a13f-219f-4bf4-a208-c810a79f1826.png)

Actual Request:
![Screenshot 2022-11-02 at 10 35 14 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94641613/199440022-d63836d1-77a2-40f0-9366-58ceb1a25e4e.png)

I am 100% sure CORS is enabled on the back-end and the origins for both Android and iOS are added there

issue.title: Need to remove all event listeners
issue.body:
Im using live reload and the js layer is setting up a plugin event listener on every reload.

Unfortunately as the native layer is not reloading the listeners are multiplying on every reload and I can see in the logs that they are all firing events, even though only the newest one is hitting the reloaded js code.

As the js code has reloaded I no longer have a reference to the listeners and so can't remove them.

There also doesn't seem to be a way of detecting before the js code reloads.

So is there a way to remove all listeners from the plugin, I'm assuming what im seeing in the logs is the plugin / bridge firing an event for each listener that was setup

issue.title: Back Navigation with Capacitor runs Angular outside NgZone on Android

labels.name: needs reproduction
labels.description: needs reproducible example to illustrate the issue

issue.body:
Hello folks,
im running into an issue implementing back navigation for an angular application:

Running ` window.history.back()` loads the previous component into the router outlet. However the constuctor of that component and `ngOnInit()` method runs outside the NgZone (`NgZone.isInAngularZone() returns false`). This happens only on Android, in Chrome everything works flawlessley. Implementing Zoneless components for the whole application is infeasabile. Rebuilding the window.history function in the application and avoid using window.history.back() seems hacky.

 Is this a known issue with Capacitor and Angular? I'd image the ionic team ran into the issue? I searched the docs, and the Internet and found nobody running into a similar issue. 

If i recall correctly the Android webview is a bit unique in how it handles URL changes. Is it possible to define custom behaviour for an urlchange via capacitor?

Relevant package.json dependencies:
```
"dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "~13.3.9",
    "@angular/cdk": "~13.3.7",
    "@angular/common": "~13.3.9",
    "@angular/compiler": "~13.3.9",
    "@angular/core": "~13.3.9",

    "@capacitor/angular": "^2.0.3",
    "@capacitor/app": "^1.1.1",
    "@capacitor/core": "^3.6.0",
    "@capacitor/ios": "^3.5.1",
    "@capacitor/push-notifications": "^1.0.9",
    ...
  },
```

issue.title: bug: ion-picker doesn't support disabled options between enabled options

labels.name: needs: reply
labels.description: the issue needs a response from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

When using an ion-picker with a list of options that begins with 1+ enabled, contains 1+ disabled options in the middle, then ends with 1+ enabled options, the selector doesn't correctly auto-select an enabled option. Further the selector allows the user to select a disabled option.

### Expected Behavior

Users should not be able to select a disabled PickerColumnOption.
PickerColumn should auto-select a valid option if the user attempts to choose a disabled option.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a simple ion-picker with a set of options - recommend 7 options to easily see the issue.
2. Set the options as follows:
- 0: disabled = false
- 1: disabled = false
- 2: disabled = true
- 3: disabled = true
- 4: disabled = true
- 5: disabled = false
- 6: disabled = 6
3. Attempt to select a disabled option.

*Note, you may need to adjust the CSS for .picker-opt-disabled in order to see the disabled options more easily.

### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/austinrzg/angular-fqvgd8

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI : 5.4.16

Utility:

   cordova-res : not installed
   native-run  : not installed

System:

   NodeJS : v16.18.1
   npm    : 8.1.2
   OS     : Windows 10

_No response_

issue.title: feat: Have the feature of "href" and "router-link" in a unified way for web and mobile apps

labels.name: ionitron: needs reproduction
labels.description: a code reproduction is needed from the issue author

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already include this feature request, without success.

### Describe the Feature Request

For now, if we use "router-link" args on ion-button or other tags in the app, this does not allow to do a "shift+click" to open a link in a new tab. For this, we need to use "href" args.

But using "href" args seems to break the "swipe-to-navigage-back" behavior on iOS.

Is it possible to reconcile both? Either have the swipe-to-navigate-back gesture work even when following href links, or have a way to selectively choose the "href-behavior" when compiling for the web, and the "router-link" behavior when compiling on mobile?

### Describe the Use Case

This would allow people to have the best of both worlds: allow to open views in new tabs when needed on web UIs, and allow to have the "swipe-to-go-back" gesture on iOS

### Describe Preferred Solution

_No response_

### Describe Alternatives

_No response_

issue.title: bug: button in modal is not announced by VoiceOver

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

labels.name: bug: external
labels.description: Bugs in non-Ionic software that impact Ionic apps (I.e. WebKit, Angular, Android etc)

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue). - [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct). - [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success. ### Ionic Framework Version - [ ] v4.x - [ ] v5.x - [X] v6.x - [ ] Nightly ### Current Behavior After upgrading to Ionic 6, the iOS VoiceOver screen reader is ignoring any ion-button elements inside an ion-modal. We are using Cordova to manage our hybrid applications. - This worked previously on Ionic version 5. - Any ion-button elements, not inside an ion-modal, are being treated as expected by the VoiceOver screen reader. - The functionality still works fine with TalkBack on Android. ### Expected Behavior When a user opens an Ionic Modal in an application on an iOS device, with the VoiceOver screen reader turned on, they should be able to navigate, by swiping right or left, to each element inside the modal, and the screen reader should read out the relevant details. This should include any ion-button elements, both in the header and the body of the modal. ### Steps to Reproduce **1. Create a simple Ionic Cordova seed app** _ionic start myApp tabs --type=angular --cordova_ **2. Add the following HTML markup to "src/app/tab2/tab2.page.html" (under the ion-header, within the ion-content)** `Open` ``   ``     ``       ``         ``           `Cancel`         ``         `Welcome`         ``           `Confirm`         ``       ``     ``     ``       `
Test Field 1
`       `Test 1`       `
Test Field 2
`       `Test 2`       `
Test Field 3
`     ``   `` `` **3. Add the following code to "src/app/tab2/tab2.page.ts"** `onWillDismiss(event) {`   `console.log(event);` `}` `cancel() {`   `this.modal.dismiss(null, 'cancel');` `}` `confirm() {`   `this.modal.dismiss(null, 'confirm');` `}` **4. Add the iOS platform** _ionic cordova platform add ios_ **5. issue.title: bug: "cap add ios" inside a lerna package generates broken Podfile since v4
issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version

```
Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.4.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.4.0
```

### Current Behavior
<!--
Describe how the bug manifests. Be specific.
-->

When I run `npx cap add ios` in any added lerna package, I run into the following error:

```
[error] 
        [!] Invalid `Podfile` file: cannot load such file --
        (...)/packages/template2/node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers.
        
        #  from (...)/packages/template2/ios/App/Podfile:1
        #  -------------------------------------------
        >  require_relative '../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers'
        #
        #  -------------------------------------------
```

Since capacitor ^4.0.0 the Podfile has this first line:

`require_relative '../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers'`

However in my lerna monorepo configuration, my capacitor node_modules packages are located further up in the tree. It works when I change the first line to the correct path:

`require_relative '../../../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers'`

Important to note that other paths in the Podfile are actually correct. See the fully generated Podfile:

```
require_relative '../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers'

platform :ios, '13.0'
use_frameworks!

# workaround to avoid Xcode caching of Pods that requires
# Product -> Clean Build Folder after new Cordova plugins installed
# Requires CocoaPods 1.6 or newer
install! 'cocoapods', :disable_input_output_paths => true

def capacitor_pods
  pod 'Capacitor', :path => '../../../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios'
  pod 'CapacitorCordova', :path => '../../../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios'

end

target 'App' do
  capacitor_pods
  # Add your Pods here
end

post_install do |installer|
  assertDeploymentTarget(installer)
end

```

### Expected Behavior
<!--
Describe what the behavior should be.
-->

The first line of the Podfile should point to the correct node_modules folder when inside a Lerna package


### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->

```
mkdir test
cd test
npx lerna init
cd packages
npm init @capacitor/app
cd app
npm install @capacitor/ios
npm run build
npx cap add ios
```

Result:

```
➜  app git:(main) ✗ npx cap add ios
✔ Adding native Xcode project in ios in 20.67ms
✔ add in 21.16ms
✔ Copying web assets from dist to ios/App/App/public in 4.69ms
✔ Creating capacitor.config.json in ios/App/App in 263.67μs
✔ copy ios in 10.89ms
✔ Updating iOS plugins in 524.17μs
[info] Found 2 Capacitor plugins for ios:
       @capacitor/camera@4.1.3
       @capacitor/splash-screen@4.1.1
✖ Updating iOS native dependencies with pod install - failed!
✖ update ios - failed!
[error] 
        [!] Invalid `Podfile` file: cannot load such file --
        (...)/test/packages/app/node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers.
        
        #  from (...)/test/packages/app/ios/App/Podfile:1
        #  -------------------------------------------
        >  require_relative '../../node_modules/@capacitor/ios/scripts/pods_helpers'
        #
        #  -------------------------------------------
```

### Other Technical Details
<!--
Please provide the following information with your request and any other relevant technical details (versions of IDEs, local environment info, plugin information or links, etc).
-->

`npm --version` output: 8.12.1

`node --version` output: v14.19.3

`pod --version` output (iOS issues only): 1.11.3

### Additional Context
<!--
List any other information that is relevant to your issue. Stack traces, related issues, suggestions on how to fix, Stack Overflow links, forum links, etc.
-->

Suggestion to fix:

File: `cli/src/ios/update.ts`
@ async function generatePodFile()

This function changes the Capacitor and CapacitorCordova paths to the correct node_modules folder. I'm not sure what happens in this file, but I'd suggest to make updates to the first line of the Podfile here as well.

issue.title: bug: jest takes --max-workers as a file pattern when it is not specified and a pattern is provided

labels.name: ionitron: needs reproduction
labels.description: This PR or Issue does not have a reproduction case URL

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Stencil Version

`> 2.19.0`

### Current Behavior

When stencil test is called with a file pattern, without specifying the max workers in the pool like this:

`npx stencil test --e2e -- some-file-name.e2e.ts`

stencil adds the `--max-workers` argument to the end of the passed arguments, and gets passed to jest like this:

`jest args: --e2e -- some-file-name.e2e.ts --max-workers=8`

but jest expects that `'--'` is _only_ followed by filename patterns and that all flags like `--json` are before it in the argument list, therefore the ```--max-workers``` has no effect and indeed jest interprets it as a file pattern:

`Ran all test suites matching /some-file-name.e2e.ts|--max-workers=8/i.`

The bug got introduced with: https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/pull/3730/commits/8a221e8ed41e5dc4dd932c5d7a011d54e0a3acb2

### Expected Behavior

Jest `--max-workers` arg should be passed before `--` when not specified.

### System Info

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

Run a test with a file pattern, without specifying the num of max-workers. Like:
`npx stencil test --e2e -- some-file-name.e2e.ts`

### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework

### Additional Information

I would open a PR to solve this issue.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

We build an ionic application for iOS and Android and as SPA for our website. 
Opened Ionic modals in the browser (website) on mobile devices like Google Pixel 6 do not fill the full browser screen, in case the adressbar is hidden. 

![Bildschirmfoto 2022-10-25 um 14 18 55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8022875/197771474-0d549ba2-a6f4-4710-8809-ac8daebcd544.png)

The modals should have the full height even if the adressbar on mobile devices is hidden.

You see like in the screenshot above, that the modal didn’t fill the full browser. There is space at the bottom of the modal (the green background). This space seems to be exactly the space of the hidden address bar from browser. If you scroll up in the modal and the address bar appears, the modal has the right full height.

issue.title: bug(vue): redirecting in a navigation guard after going back does not show the correct view
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

Relevant context:

I have an app with a home page, a settings page, and a login page.
The login page navigates to the home page after login, or back to the route it was redirected from.
The home page has a button to navigate to the settings page and the settings page has a back button.

There is a `beforeEach` navigation guard that checks if the user is logged in; if they are not, it redirects to the login page. If they are logged in, it checks if the destination is the login page; if so, it redirects to the home page.

Now for the problem:

When I try to go to the settings page directly (by entering the URL) while logged out, I am redirected to the login page as expected. After logging in, I am taken to the settings page, again as expected.

The back button does not work correctly now. The initial "back" navigation is to the login page, so the navigation guard redirects to the home page. However, the view shown is the login page. The URL is for the home page.
The same happens when using `router.back()`.

It seems to be caused at least in part by the way Ionic's view stack works.

I am now using `replace` instead of `push` (which was actually "incorrect"), even if this does unfortunately mean I no longer get a navigation animation when navigating from the login page. I understand that this was caused by a "bad" implementation of mine, but this situation could arise in other contexts.

### Expected Behavior

I would expect Ionic to wait until the navigation was confirmed and then check if the final route was the same as the one "back" from the current view. If the route was the same, Ionic would pop the current view as normal; if it was not (i.e., a navigation guard had caused a redirect), Ionic would create the correct view for the new route, render it beneath the current page, rewrite the page stack to include just that view and the current one, and then navigate to that view as if going back.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup
    1. Create an Ionic Vue app with three pages, "home", "settings", and "login".
    2. Add a button/link from the home page to the settings page.
    3. Add a back button from the settings page, default route being for the home page.
    4. Put a button on the login page that pushes to the settings page and stores a flag in global state (e.g. via a Vue composable).
    5. Make a navigation guard that checks the flag and (a) redirects to the login page if it is not set and (b) redirects to the home page if it is set and the current destination is the login page.
2. Enter the URL for the settings page directly. You should be redirected immediately to the login page.
3. Click the button to go to the settings page.
4. Click the back button. The URL should change to the home page but the view shown will be the login page.

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

```
Ionic:

   Ionic CLI       : 6.16.3 (C:\Users\Darryl\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\@ionic\cli)
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/vue 6.2.6

Utility:

   cordova-res : not installed globally
   native-run  : not installed globally

System:

   NodeJS : v18.4.0 (C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe)
   npm    : 8.12.1
   OS     : Windows 10
```

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: feat:
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already include this feature request, without success.

### Describe the Feature Request

Add a css custom property or another shadow part to the ion-button component allowing to customise the placement of the content inside the ion-button.

### Describe the Use Case

Buttons in iOS "list form" have very often their content placed on the left.
I would like to have the same behaviour easily.

### Describe Preferred Solution

I see two solutions, a custom shadow part that give access to the span inside the native button that allows to customize the span css. Or, give a add a --justify-content custom property that allows to place the content inside the button.

### Describe Alternatives

We can add an extra html span tag inside the button and customize its css. It's not very convenient.

### Related Code

_No response_

_No response_

issue.title: Request more documentation and example(s) for 6.x VanillaJS "Navigation/Routing" of Ionic Docs

labels.name: needs: reply
labels.description: the issue needs a response from the user

issue.body:
I can't tell if there is an "issue/bug" or if I am just doing it wrong  because there isn't adequate documentation for VanillaJS "Routing and Navigation" comparable to the Angular, React, and Vue sections of Docs.

When I use the following in index.html it works as expected, no issues...

```
    <ion-app>

        <ion-router>

	    <ion-route url="/" component="home-view"></ion-route>

        </ion-router>

        <ion-router-outlet></ion-router-outlet>

    </ion-app>

```

However when I create an "app-root" component (similar to the ionic-stencil-conference-app example) and move this code to it and then insert the "app-root" component into index.html it no longer routes as expected and instead I get an empty "slot"?

I suspect I'm missing something, but despite looking all over the internet I am unable to determine what because of the lack of documentation.

Yes I realize Vanilla JS is not a popular as Angular, React, and Vue so isn't a top priority.

Thank You!

issue.title: bug: Modal and Popover trigger event listeners are not destroyed

labels.name: package: core
labels.description: @ionic/core package

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

Both `ion-popover` and `ion-modal` do not destroy the event listeners that are attached when using a trigger, when the component is unmounted. 

Discussion here: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/pull/26081#discussion_r991293980

### Expected Behavior

When using `ion-popover` or `ion-modal` with a trigger, the event listeners should be removed when the component is unmounted. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Present a popover or modal using a trigger
2. Remove the overlay from the DOM
3. Observe: The event listener is still attached.

### Code Reproduction URL

https://codepen.io/liamdebeasi/pen/XWqyaWq

### Ionic Info

N/A

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x

### Current Behavior

When a change is made in an IonSelect with `multiple={true}`, it triggers onIonChange 3 times with the following behavior:

Trigger 1) Values as array
Trigger 2) Values as comma-separated string
Trigger 3) Values as array

Obviously, this is very bad as it should only trigger once, and the 2nd trigger violates the Array<T> exected type.

### Expected Behavior

onIonChange should only trigger once, and should include only an array of values, not a comma-separated string.

### Steps to Reproduce

This happens with any IonSelect with multiple={true}. See example project below.

issue.title: bug: react - maximum depth exceeded from PrivateRoute
issue.body:
# Bug Report

**Ionic version:**
[ ] **4.x**
[x] **5.x**

**Current behavior:**
Redirecting from a PrivateRoute causes "Maximum update depth exceeded".

**Expected behavior:**
Redirect to, for example, a "/login" page.

I have been trying to use the PrivateRoute pattern described [here](https://reactrouter.com/web/example/auth-workflow) without success.

**Steps to reproduce:**

`ionic start ionic-react-redirect-bug conference --type=react`
`cd ionic-react-redirect-bug`


Add the following to `src/App.tsx`:
```
interface PrivateRouteProps extends RouteProps {
  component: any;
}

const PrivateRoute = ({component: Component, ...rest}: PrivateRouteProps) => {
  const isLoggedIn = false;

  return (
    <Route
      {...rest}
      render={(routeProps) =>
        isLoggedIn ? (
          <Component {...routeProps} />
        ) : (
          <Redirect to={{pathname: "/login", state: {from: routeProps.location}}}/>
        )
      }
    />
  );
}
```


In `src/App.tsx` replace:

`<Route path="/support" component={Support} />`

with:

`<PrivateRoute path="/support" component={Support} />`


Comment out `useEffect` in `src/components/Map.tsx` if it complains about anything (unrelated to this issue).


`ionic serve`

Click the `Support` menu item.


**Other information:**

In the browser console:

```
Uncaught Error: Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.
    React 4
    unlisten react-router.js:69
    listener history.js:162
    notifyListeners history.js:180
    notifyListeners history.js:179
    setState history.js:300
    replace history.js:414
    confirmTransitionTo history.js:152
    replace history.js:397
    onUpdate react-router.js:309
    componentDidUpdate react-router.js:189
    React 6
    unstable_runWithPriority scheduler.development.js:659
    React 5
    unstable_runWithPriority scheduler.development.js:659
    React 6
```

**Ionic info:**

```
Ionic:

   Ionic CLI       : 6.10.1 (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@ionic/cli)
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/react 5.2.3

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI   : 1.3.0
   @capacitor/core : 1.3.0

Utility:

System:

   npm    : 6.14.6
   OS     : macOS Catalina
```

issue.title: bug: StatusBar setOverlaysWebView overlay false does not work.
issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version

```
@capacitor/cli: 3.4.3
@capacitor/core: 3.4.3
@capacitor/android: 3.4.3
@capacitor/ios: 3.4.3
```

### Platform(s)

iOS 16.0.2

### Current Behavior

```ts
StatusBar.setOverlaysWebView({ overlay: false });
```

does not work.

### Expected Behavior

There must be a way to set the status bar to not be overlaid. It should be possible to leave the status bar unaffected by HTML content.
For example if your app provides a light and dark mode, it's impossible to handle the color of the status bar. You don't know the background. `StatusBar.setStyle({ style: this.settings.darkMode ? Style.Dark : Style.Light });` works, but makes no sense if overlayed. I could underlay it with HTML and contrast color if I would know the height. But this is just bungling. I think the status bar behavior is something to configure in WebView. So I don't need to care about the StatusBar or my content underneath. Just render the app below the status bar. No need for safe areas, styles, etc. 

### Code Reproduction

Just create a new app and execute the code above.

### Other Technical Details

`npm --version` output: 8.5.0

`node --version` output: 16.14.2

`pod --version` output (iOS issues only): 1.11.3

issue.title: bug: @Event types missing
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil-ds-output-targets/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Stencil Version

2.19.2

### Stencil Framework Output Target

Angular

### Stencil Framework Output Target Version

0.4.0

### Current Behavior

So far I had no issues with this stencilJs plugin, but now I've added the following to one of my components

      @Event( { bubbles: false, composed: true } ) treeNodeCheckChanged: EventEmitter<FooEvent>;

Now when I build the angular app, the following error is thrown

    Module '"@web-components/dist/components"' has no exported member 'FooEvent'.

The configuration I added to stencil.config.js is as follows:

     angularOutputTarget({
          componentCorePackage: '@web-components/dist/components',
          directivesProxyFile: './../demo/src/libs/stencil-generated/proxies.ts',
          valueAccessorConfigs: angularValueAccessorBindings,
     }),

Which works without that `@Event` statement!



### Expected Behavior

It should've included the interface `FooEvent` to the proxies.ts file. Inside the proxies.ts files this interface is imported as follows

    import type { FooEvent as IMyComponentFooEvent } from '@web-components/dist/components';

but `FooEvent` is nowhere exported.

### Steps to Reproduce

I've comitted my test setup [here](https://github.com/scaljeri/stenciljs-angular-bug)

The generated files are already generated and included. So to reproduce the error do

    $> cd demo
    $> yarn
    $> yarn build

### Code Reproduction URL

https://github.com/scaljeri/stenciljs-angular-bug

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: feat: Ability to develop third-party platform integration like iOS and Android
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already include this feature request, without success.

### Describe the Feature Request

Since Cordova supports developing a new platform, we are considering if Capacitor could provide similar capacity.

### Describe the Use Case

We have successfully integrated GeckoView with Ionic, but it's pretty hard to make the integration play well with the ionic framework, what we want is bundle the platform based on GeckoView into an independent package, similar to `@capacitor/android`, we want to build a package called `@recative/ionic-android-geckoview`, 
in this way, we can build package based on Chromium WebView and GeckoView at the same time for different market. 

#### Why?
It's pretty important for us to build an Android Application based on GeckoView for some country like China, since Google Play is not available in these countries, as a result, a lot of Android devices have a pretty old WebView (Like Chromium 72 or Chromium 64).

some vendors like MI are also troublemakers which tried to modify the UA and pretend their WebView is newer than what it actually is.

To handle complex problems, we think ship GeckoView with the application is a better solution. But for the market that covered by Google Play, we still want to use Android WebView since it's smaller, has a better performance. 

For these reasons, treat the combination of Android and GeckoView as an independent platform is more practical for us, so we drafted this issue.

issue.title: bug: Popover incorrectly positions in footer

labels.name: package: core
labels.description: @ionic/core package

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

When an ion-popover containing an ion-list is added to an ion-toolbar in a ion-footer it shows as cut-off. The same behavior shows on both mobile and desktop browser views. The same behavior shows if the ion-toolbar is not within an ion-footer.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8585839/199264879-d8f075e8-c9f7-4fc9-928e-2f08cbd6ca9b.png)


### Expected Behavior

Popover to display all three ion-item elements on the screen in this example.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a blank ionic project.

2. In src\app\home\home.page.html, paste the following code after the closing ion-content tag.

3. Do an ionic serve and click the "popover button".

```
<!-- Existing template code -->
</ion-content>

<!-- New template code -->
<ion-footer>
    <ion-toolbar>
        <ion-buttons slot="start">
            <ion-button id="button-popover">
                popover button
            </ion-button>
        </ion-buttons>
    </ion-toolbar>
</ion-footer>

<ion-popover trigger="button-popover" triggerAction="trigger">
    <ng-template>
        <ion-content>
            <ion-list>
                <ion-item detail>test</ion-item>
                <ion-item detail>test2</ion-item>
                <ion-item detail>test3</ion-item>
            </ion-list>
        </ion-content>
    </ng-template>
</ion-popover>
```

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

issue.title: bug:  Ionic 6 production build causes white screen in ios versions 14.4 and lower
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

ionic-angular app with production build (--prod) causes "ionic white screen of death" in ios versions  13.5 and 14.4 (both in simulators and real device) but not sure about the real span of version for this behaviour.
app works and responds in the background but nothing on screen

### Expected Behavior

ionic-angular production build should work without problem in these versions of ios

### Steps to Reproduce

create blank ionic-angular app with either capacitor or cordova
capacitor:
ionic build --prod
npx cap sync 

cordova:
ionic cordova build ios --prod

when running the app no problem in ios 16.0 but white screen on mentioned older versions of ios

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

Ionic:

   Ionic CLI                     : 6.20.3 (/Users/emreakkoc/.nvm/versions/node/v16.10.0/lib/node_modules/@ionic/cli)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 6.3.3
   @angular-devkit/build-angular : 14.2.7

Cordova:

Utility:

   cordova-res : 0.15.4
   native-run  : 1.7.1

System:

   ios-deploy : 1.11.4
   ios-sim    : 8.0.2
   NodeJS     : v16.10.0 (/Users/emreakkoc/.nvm/versions/node/v16.10.0/bin/node)
   npm        : 8.19.2
   OS         : macOS Monterey
   Xcode      : Xcode 14.0.1 Build version 14A400



### Additional Information
--prod flag is deprecated since angular 13 but 
`ionic cordova build ios --configuration production`
also did not help and causes the same behaviour

issue.title: feat(scrollbar): force light / dark mode
issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue). - [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct). - [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already include this feature request, without success. ### Describe the Feature Request Currently the scrollbar is light on darkmode and dark on lightmode. If your device is on darkmode and the app content background is light, the scrollbar is hardly to find. It should be possible to force the mode, so scrollbar is visible on light content. In the screenshots below you see one in dark and the other in light mode: ## Darkmode ## Lightmode ### Describe the Use Case Developers should be able to force scrollbarColor to light or dark, so it fits to their content background-color. ### Describe Preferred Solution extend `IonicConfig` with: `scrollbarColor: 'auto' | 'light' | 'dark'` default: `auto` so it can be applied globally ### Describe Alternatives you have to style it by your own, which is not consistent with different browsers or might break with future releases: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues/25217#issuecomment-1113324340 ### Related Code _No response_ ### Additional Information _No response_

issue.title: bug: minWebViewVersion is not working as expected

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: A new feature, enhancement, or improvement

issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version
<!--
Paste the output from the `npx cap doctor` command into the code block below. This will provide the versions of Capacitor packages and related dependencies.
-->

```
Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.1.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.1.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.1.0
```

### Platform(s)
<!--
List the platforms that this bug affects.
-->
- Android



### Current Behavior
<!--
Describe how the bug manifests. Be specific.
-->

The specified min webview version is ignored when changed in the capacitor.config.ts config. Also is the option [not documented](https://capacitorjs.com/docs/config)  as expected.

```
  android: {
    minWebViewVersion: 80,
  },
```

The log prints the following version

`I/WebViewFactory: Loading com.google.android.webview version 61.0.3163.98 (code 316409850)`


### Expected Behavior
<!--
Describe what the behavior should be.
-->
The app should prompt the user to update the webview package



### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->
Create an Android 8 Emulator, set the min sdk to version 70 and start the capacitor app. The Log will print out web view version 61 but the user is not prompted to update the web view package



### Additional Context
<!--
List any other information that is relevant to your issue. Stack traces, related issues, suggestions on how to fix, Stack Overflow links, forum links, etc.
-->

issue.title: bug: Geolocation on Android always returning 'location unavailable'
issue.body:
## Bug Report

### Capacitor Version
<!--
Paste the output from the `npx cap doctor` command into the code block below. This will provide the versions of Capacitor packages and related dependencies.
-->

```
💊   Capacitor Doctor  💊 

Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/core: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/android: 3.2.0
  @capacitor/ios: 3.2.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/core: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/android: 3.0.0
  @capacitor/ios: 3.1.2

[error] Xcode is not installed
[success] Android looking great! 👌
```

### Platform(s)
<!--
List the platforms that this bug affects.
-->
Android 10


### Current Behavior
<!--
Describe how the bug manifests. Be specific.
-->
When I try to call Geolocation.getCurrentPosition(), I always get an error: 'location unavailable'. I've tried this with no options and {enableHighAccuracy: true}.

I have the appropriate permissions set and the code works on PWA and iOS. The app has Location permission while in the foreground and Google Maps can get my location fine.


### Expected Behavior
<!--
Describe what the behavior should be.
-->

Geolocation.getCurrentPosition() should provide the lat/lng of the current position.

### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->

**edit:** basic repo set up here: https://github.com/jonathan-chin/capacitor-geocode-android-example
clicking on the `get currentposition` button will return `location unavailable` when running on a Google Pixel 3A on Android 10 through Android Studio.

it seems to have been an existing issue in the past #2854 but I am still experiencing it.

issue.body:

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).

<!-- Please make sure you are posting an issue pertaining to the Ionic Framework. If you are having an issue with the Ionic Appflow services (Ionic View, Ionic Deploy, etc.) please consult the Ionic Appflow support portal (https://ionic.zendesk.com/hc/en-us) -->

<!-- Please do not submit support requests or "How to" questions here. Instead, please use one of these channels: https://forum.ionicframework.com/ or http://ionicworldwide.herokuapp.com/ -->

<!-- ISSUES MISSING IMPORTANT INFORMATION MAY BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATION. -->

# Bug Report

**Ionic version:**
<!-- (For Ionic 1.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v1) -->
<!-- (For Ionic 2.x & 3.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v3) -->
[x] **5.0.7**

**Current behavior:**
I'm using the `IonRange` component with `dualKnobs`. When trying to set a default value _and_ update state with `onIonChange` the parent component gets into an infinite render loop as soon as I update the range state. 

**Expected behavior:**
I should be able set the default value of the `lower` and `upper` knobs by setting the `value` prop of `IonRange`. This works, but as soon slide one of the knobs, the parent component repeatedly re-renders forever.  


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a component with that renders an `IonRange` component and also `useState`. You can see an example here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ionic-react-demo-tt4ytk?file=pages%2FHome.jsx

As soon as you adjust one of the knobs (and `onIonChange` is called), you will see that the component is rendered in a loop - `console.log('render')` is called repeatedly forever.

**Related code:**
```
const MyComponent = () => {
  const defaultValue = {lower: 40, upper: 70};
  const [range, setRange] = useState(defaultValue);
  
  console.log('render');

  return (
    <IonRange dualKnobs={true} min={0} max={100} value={{...defaultValue}} onIonChange={ e => setRange(e.detail.value) }>
      <IonLabel slot="start">{range.lower}</IonLabel>
      <IonLabel slot="end">{range.upper}</IonLabel>
    </IonRange>        
  );
};
```


**Other information:**
<!-- List any other information that is relevant to your issue. Stack traces, related issues, suggestions on how to fix, Stack Overflow links, forum links, etc. -->

**Ionic info:**
<!-- (run `ionic info` from a terminal/cmd prompt and paste output below): -->

```
Ionic:

   Ionic CLI       : 6.6.0 
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/react 5.0.7

Capacitor:

   Capacitor CLI   : 2.0.0
   @capacitor/core : 2.0.0

Utility:

   cordova-res : not installed
   native-run  : not installed

System:

   NodeJS : v12.16.1 
   npm    : 6.13.4
   OS     : macOS Catalina
```

issue.title: feat: `ionChange` event: determine whether it by user interaction

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: a new feature, enhancement, or improvement

labels.name: package: core
labels.description: @ionic/core package

issue.body:
# Feature Request

**Ionic version:**
<!-- (For Ionic 1.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v1) -->
<!-- (For Ionic 2.x & 3.x issues, please use https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-v3) -->
[x] **4.10**

**Describe the Feature Request**
Add a way to figure out if the `checked` value of `ion-toggle` was changed by user interaction or programatically.

**Describe Preferred Solution**
Add a new property to the event object or the `detail` property.

**Describe Alternatives**

1. Add a new event (e.g. `ionUserChange`) that only fires on user interaction. 
2. Add the original event to `detail`.

All of these solutions could be expanded to other components.

**Related Code**
Same request: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic/issues/17123

**Additional Context**
My use case: I have a dark mode toggle and on `ionChange` I save the user's preference. Until the user manually sets the toggle I use the OS setting (which I get using `window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')`). When the OS setting changes the toggle should change as well. But this saves the new value and no longer checks the OS preference.

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: @ionic/react package

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

Presenting an inline overlay (popover or modal) a second time will result in the content of the overlay not displaying. 

Caused by: https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/pull/26154

### Expected Behavior

Inline overlays should consistently display their contents, regardless if the first time the overlay is presented or the 100th. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an inline overlay with popover or modal
2. Open the overlay
3. Observe: Overlay displays correctly
4. Close the overlay
5. Re-open the overlay
6. Observe: The overlay is blank
7. Inspecting the DOM will show that `.ion-delegate-host` element is created and pushes the overlay contents off screen.

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

N/A

### Additional Information

_No response_

### Description
It would be useful to be able to require a specific minimum WebView version on Android to avoid the "white screen of death" if the application won't work due to lack of newer JS feature support.

Android

If the WebView is too old, Capacitor could, for example, display a (localized) error dialog, advise the user to update WebView and abort.

issue.body:
# Bug
Unable to run a single e2e test

## Details
Unable to run single e2e test after upgrading from _v2.16.1_ to _v2.19.3_

Command used: `npx stencil test --e2e dialog.e2e.ts`

## Work around
I am able to get the same functionality by adding `--` as an extra arg

Command used: `npx stencil test --e2e -- dialog.e2e.ts`

## Screenshots

### v2.16.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779216-03966fd1-452c-4e9d-9642-81c38048b817.png)

### v2.19.3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779088-7b4d28dd-217f-4f62-a74c-a85a3b98ba53.png)

### v2.19.3 with workaround
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8199374/205779425-2dc0b7ec-852d-422a-a915-925aa249cfbd.png)

_Originally posted by @bamsargeant in https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/3827#issuecomment-1338509558_

issue.title: bug: plugin for IOS custom viewController will not display view.
issue.body:
## Bug Report
I'm building a plugin and my custom view will not open. It acts like the view controller can't find the xib file.
see [stackoverflow](url) 
### Capacitor Version

```
💊   Capacitor Doctor  💊 

Latest Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.4.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.4.0

Installed Dependencies:

  @capacitor/cli: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/core: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/android: 4.3.0
  @capacitor/ios: 4.3.0

[success] iOS looking great! 👌
```

### Platform(s)
IOS, I have the plugin working fine on Android

### Current Behavior
My issue is that the view doesn't display, I get a black screen on the simulator. It's like the controller can't find the xib view file. Degbugging I get the events firing: viewDidLoad(), ViewDidAppear(). The links between the controller and the xib are all good in xCode. I tested with an UIAlertController and it displays OK.

### Expected Behavior
Load my map view

### Code Reproduction
<!--
To isolate the cause of the problem, we ask you to provide a minimal sample application that demonstrates the issue.
For full instructions, see: https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-a-code-reproduction
-->
```
DispatchQueue.main.async {
    let  mapCtrl = NavigateRouteViewController(withRouteInfo: routeInfo)
    mapCtrl.modalPresentationStyle = .fullScreen
    self.bridge!.viewController!.present(mapCtrl, animated: true, completion: nil)            
}
```


### Other Technical Details

`npm --version` output: 8.19.2

`node --version` output: v16.13.0

`pod --version` output (iOS issues only): 1.10.1

### Additional Context

issue.title: bug: useIonLoading, message container is always rendered even when not using a message

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: @ionic/react package

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: a confirmed bug report

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#creating-an-issue).
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://ionicframework.com/code-of-conduct).
- [X] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues) that already report this problem, without success.

### Ionic Framework Version

- [ ] v4.x
- [ ] v5.x
- [X] v6.x
- [ ] Nightly

### Current Behavior

Using the useIonLoading() hook with the minimum parameters, we have a design error.

![useIonLoading bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199714749-bec1da11-0309-4af3-afab-4c83915d4b24.png)
![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199715939-f0df1373-5576-47f5-a50a-d5b39d76b1c2.png)

This element should not render if the message parameter is empty.

![bug-example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199715438-0f683756-34a8-4632-9410-09d0e385da73.png)

### Expected Behavior

This should be the default behavior.
![default_behaviour](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26112509/199716071-10f44788-41f6-4e4a-8322-afa8d0b80dfc.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

Using the `<IonLoading isOpen={true} />` component works perfectly. The bug is not in the core. The bug occurs when receiving the default parameters in useIonLoading.

````tsx
const [present, dismiss] = useIonLoading();
useEffect(()=>{
    present();
}, [])
````

### Code Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Ionic Info

   Ionic CLI       : 6.20.3
   Ionic Framework : @ionic/react 6.3.4

Capacitor:

System:
